Github user harshach commented on the pull request:

+1

> @vesense after signing up for a JIRA account, I created the following. I hope it was set up properly: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/STORM-1422

Looks good.  Can you edit the title of this pull request to include `STORM-1422` so they are linked?

githubbot:

Github user d2r commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/979#issuecomment-167623574

> @vesense after signing up for a JIRA account, I created the following. I hope it was set up properly: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/STORM-1422

Looks good. Can you edit the title of this pull request to include `STORM-1422` so they are linked?

@conkeyn,

Could you change commit messages to English, create a Jira issue for this pull request, and fix the conflicts with the master branch?

@forview,

This pull request seems to be open in error.  I will close it soon.  If there is something that needs to be addressed in storm, please create a Jira issue and add `STORM-XXXX` to the title of the pull request.

@vesense, could you create a Jira issue for this change and add it to the title of this pull request?

What problem is the current scope causing here that needs to be fixed?
@chuanlei , it looks like the source repository has been deleted. Would you create a Jira for this work, and submit a new pull request?
@knusbaum, would you put this to a VOTE so we can make a decision on merging it in.

@l03wn3, is STORM_JAR_JVM_OPTS OK for debugging this way?

If so, would you close this pull request?  Otherwise, would you create a Jira issue for this change?
@emidln , it has been a while since the last comment.  Would you create a Jira issue for this work, address the comment by @revans2 , and resolve conflicts with the master branch?

@onlychoice , did you try what @harshach  suggests?

If we still need a change here, would you create a Jira issue for this work?
@caofangkun , is this pull request still valid?  Would you create a Jira issue for it?

@krichter722 this pull request has been inactive for months, so I will be closing it soon.  Please reopen the pull request if you would like to address the comments.  If you do, please create a Jira for this work and resolve conflicts with the master branch.

@knusbaum depending on what @krichter722 is seeking to fix, I could see benefit to cleaning up things like excessive compiler warnings.

@krichter722, what in particular does this fix?

@darionyaphet, I will be closing this pull request soon since it is inactive.  Please re-open if it is a mistake.  If you do, it would be good to have a Jira issue and some performance numbers that demonstrate the issue.

> @krichter722, what in particular does this fix?

Compiler warnings.
@ogorun, how should we move forward with this work?  Has this issue been resolved as part of STORM-650, or does it still need to be addressed?

githubbot:

Github user d2r commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/406#issuecomment-167632103

@ogorun, how should we move forward with this work? Has this issue been resolved as part of STORM-650, or does it still need to be addressed?
@Parth-Brahmbhatt should we close this pull request for now?
@anyatch I will be closing this pull request for inactivity.  If this is in error, please re-open it, create a Jira for the work, and resolve current conflicts with the master branch.

— Diff: examples/storm-starter/README.markdown —
@@ -72,23 +72,6 @@ the Maven command to build and run storm-starter (see below), Maven will then be
of Storm in this local Maven repository at `$HOME/.m2/repository`.

      1. Running topologies with Maven
      • End diff –

@ptgoetz, what do you think of this change to remove these instructions?

What is the use case for running topologies using maven?

githubbot:

Github user d2r commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/storm/pull/979#issuecomment-167649310

@ptgoetz, what do you think of this change to remove these instructions? Asking because I see your name on that section of the README.

What is the use case for running topologies using maven?

It seems since storm-core is not in compile scope, it is not on the classpath for the exec plugin?
-1 This is merely a formatting change, and we typically do not merge these.
@wuchong Is it OK to merge it in even with the minor commits?

The commits is  unimportant .  That's fine to  merge  It.

I don't think tick tuples needs to be acked. They are inserted directly into the receive-queue of the executor at specified intervals.

+ private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(DirLock.class);
